reviews.review: I mean...what rating do you THINK your gonna get Marvel when you make a movie where all the heroes die at the end????

The most satisfying comic-book move to date. Big, bold and full of action while still giving us some nuanced performances that leave us wanting more.  A movie that gets funnier and more engaging with each viewing.
Good movie, but 1st movie was better
This is one of the best films I have seen in a long time. Most definitely one of the best Marvel films and can't wait for the next one!!

With the abundance of films being put out by Disney like a well-oiled machine, this film leaves the factory with a sweet smell and AAA grade opportunity. 
The third film in the Avengers trilogy and the 19th film in the Marvel Cinematic Universe hits every mark it had too. Thanos was the villain that decades of build up
finally earned. He not only proved to be incredibly intimidating but also with some heart. He was not just a killer, he has a goal, to balance the universe, and the
heroes of the Universe are in the way. With every single film culminating into this, there was so much to live up to, and it did so. Every character was represented 
excellently. The women were given many epic scenes including the finale's insanity. The ending of the film was the best option that could have come out in this. Some
people were angered by it, but not even they realize that once the fourth film comes out, their spirits will be enlightened. There were some moments that had me 
scratching my head, like when Peter is angered by Thanos on Titan, many of the people there could have stopped Quill, but instead, nothing happened. One of the 
biggest surprises of the film was the return of Red Skull, who was sadly not reprised by Hugo Weaving. There were no major lows of the film, small ones that did not
majorly affect the grading of the film. Now we must wait a year until we see part two and the end of the Infinity War. This film was fun, heartbreaking and exhaugsted.
All in all, nearly perfect.
What a disaster. A shabby mix of everything we've seen.
The acting and the action is great but the writing is sloppy and takes a long time to really get anything going.

Certainly a well produced, huge-fun-ball of entertainment & action. Thor (surprisingly for me) and Stark took MVPs for written characters. Some hammy acting here n there (especially from Dinklage, among others), but then that's chalkable to comic book theatrics. Overall a fun ride. B- P.S. SPOILER: It was pretty astounding how they went from small loss to small loss repeatedly and then ultimately settled in what I'd amount to a draw; But then I think there's something to be gleaned from where they're left.

A very solid and honorable attempt at the Infinity Gauntlet story line by Marvel with the exception of leaving out Adam Warlock. Lots of great action and a great attemtpt to handle so many characters with different arcs going at the same time. The acting was strong, effects top notch and the lack of political posturing coming out of the comic book industry and a refreshing bonus.
